sequence: <size=51>One must evolve in order to survive.</size>
<size=51>For the weak to become extinct is a fact of nature.</size>
<size=51>Those who perished were simply too weak. Nothing more.</size>
<size=51>If this is to be my fate, then at least let me meet my end on the battlefield.</size>
<size=51>I now entrust the future of the Combined Fleet- no, of the Sakura Empire to you...</size>

scripts.say: Amagi, there's trouble! Kaga just left this letter before charging straight towards the Siren-controlled Mirror Sea by herself!
A destroyer division has already been deployed to chase after her, but they lack the firepower to handle recon on the Mirror Sea...
Amagi, standing there emotionlessly, receives Kaga's letter from Ashigara.
(It's just like you to write something like this, Kaga... Could you be...)
I understand the situation. Please continue the search. I shall handle the rest.
Understood!
Since the singing of that "Treaty," everything has changed...
We're not the only ones who were affected. Even those girls in the Eagle Union...
Amagi, will our equipment also be dismantled and replaced with those strange things...?
I haven't even had a chance to experience the recoil of my 41cm cannons yet...
Our time is short, and there is something I still must finish. But before that, I have to bring Kaga back first.
(However, sending a hastily cobbled-together fleet into Siren territory is extremely ill-advised... What should I do...?)
Say, Amagi, are these little mosquitoes really able to replace the splendor of our main batteries?
From the very beginning, the world has never judged who is weak or strong. You are just using that as an excuse to escape from reality.
... Mosquitoes?
... That's right! There is a way!
To Akagi's surprise, the normally collected Amagi let out a yell and bolted out of the room.
*Gasp* *Gasp* ... Houshou, do you have... some spare time?
Amagi! What brought you here in such a hurry?
Whether it was because she hadn't exercised without her rigging for so long or because she'd ran there in a hurry, Amagi seemed out of breath.
After taking several deep breaths, Amagi clasped Houshou's shoulders.
Houshou, as the first aircraft carrier of the Sakura Empire, I have a favor to ask of you...
Are you able to send your planes to search for Kaga in the Mirror Sea?
Eh? Kaga? B-but I only learned how to use these planes recently... I don't have any real combat experience...
Please, I'm begging you, you only have to find Kaga. I'll handle the rest.
I don't quite understand the situation, but for you to be this desperate... I'll see what I can do.
As if embraced by the sea breeze, Houshou extended her hand towards the horizon like she was parting the clouds-
As her words vanished into the wind, over a dozen aircraft began to materialize from Houshou's flight deck, encircling the sky above her.
Amagi, Akagi, and the newly-arrived escort fleet could only watch in silence, mouths agape, as they witnessed the spectacle in front of them for the first time.
...For a brief moment, they thought they could see the first rays of an era about to dawn.
Please help search for Kaga in the dark clouds of the Mirror Seas~
And most importantly, everyone, please come back safely!
With Houshou's instructions, the aircraft fanned out in seven different directions, soon disappearing into the distance.
Thank you so much for your assistance, Houshou. I'll definitely bring Kaga back. Also...
Amagi drew close to Houshou, her lips brushing against her ear, whispering something before pulling away. With that, she took a deep bow of gratitude before leading the escort fleet away.
I understand. May the Gods of Fortune be with you.
Sister, you're now going to search the Mirror Seas by staying in contact with those planes, right? I also-
See that, Akagi? Aren't those planes far more capable than you had first expected?
As for you, your new armaments are still not complete. There's no way we'd be able to risk you on the front lines. Be a good girl and wait back in port for your new equipment, all right?
B-but... I can't help but have a bad feeling about this still...
Listen to your big sister. I swear to bring Kaga back safely.
Amagi smiled warmly in an attempt to console her little sister before turning towards the ocean and departing...
But she could not hide the unease and anxiety seeping out from her smile, not even from herself.
